intro: Argostemma subcrassum, commonly known as the broad-leaved argostemma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
